result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J Lampkin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week.  If not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  AODA and follow through.  DNA sample.

Case Called: 3:23 pm 
INCLUDES 15CM2050, 16CM2534, 16CM2535, 15CM1770, 16CM384, 16CF420, 15CF1152, 15CF954, 15CF955, 16CF479, AND 16CF101. 
State appears by ADA Chris Plaunt; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Pauline Toulouse. 
VRCW. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CM2050: Ct. 3>>9 months MCJ with 446 days credit. 
In 16CM2534: Ct. 1>>6 months MCJ with 343 days credit. 
In 16CM2535: Ct. 1>>9 months MCJ with 343 days credit. 
In 15CM1770: Ct. 2>>90 days MCJ with 446 days credit. 
In 16CM384: Ct. 1>>6 months MCJ with 446 days credit. 
In 16CF420: Ct. 1>>5 yrs imprisonment - 2 yrs IC & 3 yrs ES - with 355 days credit. 
In 15CF1152: Ct. 1>>4 yrs imprisonment - 2 yrs IC & 2 yrs ES - with 446 days credit. 
In 15CF954: Ct. 1>>3 yrs imprisonment - 1 yr IC & 2 yrs ES - with 627 days credit. 
In 15CF955: Ct. 2>>6 months MCJ with 355 days credit. 
In 16CF479: Ct. 6>>9 months MCJ with 446 days credit. 
                    : Ct. 8>>6 months MCJ with 446 days credit. 
In 16CF101: Ct. 1>>5 yrs imprisonment - 2 yrs IC & 3 yrs ES - with 355 days credit. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES>>AODA and follow through if not already done; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from controlled substances and no possession of them except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; payment of unpaid costs. 

COURT ORDERS in misd. cases>> civil judgments for unpaid financial obligations. 

COURT ORDERS all sentences to run CONCURRENT. 
COURT finds the def eligible for CIP and SAP.

COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CM2050: Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>GUILTY. 
In 15CF955: Ct. 2 (Possession of THC)>>GUILTY. 
In 16CF101: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY.

In 15CF1152: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY. 
In 15CM1770: Ct. 2 (DC)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CM2050: Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>SWH for 3 years probation. 
In 15CF955: Ct. 2 (Possession of THC)>>SWH for 3 years probation. 
In 16CF101: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>SWH for 5 years probation. 
In 16CF479: Ct. 6 (Misd. BJ)>>SWH for 3 years probation. 
                    : Ct. 8 (Possession of THC)>>SWH for 3 years probation. 
In 15CF954: Ct. 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/Attempt)>>SWH for 5 years probation - CONDITION: 9 months MCJ with huber for work/school/treatment - 6 months STAYED. 
In 16CF420: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>SWH for 5 years probation. 
In 16CM384: Ct. 1 (Possession of THC)>>SWH for 3 years probation. 
In 15CF1152: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>SWH for 5 years probation. 
In 15CM1770: Ct. 2 (DC)>>SWH for 3 years probation. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of probation on ALL: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA and follow through; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample; CC. 
COURT finds the def entitled to 91 days jail credit on ALL. 
COURT allows def to work off costs with community service if approved by COC Office. 

Adj: 8:50 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 24, 2016 at 10:15 am.
